intro: Bertya neglecta, commonly known as the slender bertya, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small white or pink flowers appear in clusters and are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. Bertya neglecta is adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal or sandy soils.
